Description: Rectangular ebony label: pierced top right-hand corner. The front surface is incised with a design showing a tower with a crenellated top, almost certainly a representation of a game-piece, with faint traces of black paint in the outlines and red paint in the carving of the internal details. The top right-hand corner of the label has been broken and repaired.
Curator's comments: Almost certainly a picture of a gaming-piece. See P. Montet, 'Kêmi' 8 (1946), 191 and pl.VIII; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ III, (1897-8), pl.XV, 3 = A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens II (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 279. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 22, pl. V ,10; P. E. Newberry, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 34 (London, 1912), pl. XXXI, 4; J. Vandier, 'Manuel d'Archeologie egyptienne', I, (2), 844 and fig. 564 P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit' I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 342.
